a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Microplastics in the surface ocean, 1950 to 2050
Microplastics are buoyant plastic materials smaller than 0.5 centimeters in diameter. Future global accumulation in
the surface ocean is shown under three plastic emissions scenarios: (1) emissions to the oceans stop in 2020; (2)
stagnate at 2020 rates; or (3) continue to grow until 2050 in line with historical plastic production rates.
